semantic_title: Principal Diagnosis Selection for Rehabilitation Admissions and Encounters
section_path: Section II > K. Admissions/Encounters for Rehabilitation

content.full_text: When the purpose for the admission/encounter is rehabilitation, sequence first the code for the condition for which the service is being performed. For example, for an admission/encounter for rehabilitation for right-sided dominant hemiplegia following a cerebrovascular infarction, report code I69.351, Hemiplegia and hemiparesis following cerebral infarction affecting right dominant side, as the first-listed or principal diagnosis. If the condition for which the rehabilitation service is being provided is no longer present, report the appropriate aftercare code as the first-listed or principal diagnosis, unless the rehabilitation service is being provided following an injury. For rehabilitation services following active treatment of an injury, assign the injury code with the appropriate seventh character for subsequent encounter as the first-listed or principal diagnosis. For example, if a patient with severe degenerative osteoarthritis of the hip, underwent hip replacement and the current encounter/admission is for rehabilitation, report code Z47.1, Aftercare following joint replacement surgery, as the first-listed or principal diagnosis. If the patient requires rehabilitation post hip replacement for right intertrochanteric femur fracture, report code S72.141D, Displaced intertrochanteric fracture of right femur, subsequent encounter for closed fracture with routine healing, as the first-listed or principal diagnosis. See Section I.C.21.c.7., Factors influencing health states and contact with health services, Aftercare. See Section I.C.19.a., for additional information about the use of 7th characters for injury codes. (Evidence: pg no: 110, L53-L60)
content.summary: Rehabilitation encounters require specific sequencing rules based on whether the original condition is still present and whether it involves injury (Evidence: pg no: 110, L53-L60)

detailed_rules.rule_text: When the purpose for the admission/encounter is rehabilitation, sequence first the code for the condition for which the service is being performed (Evidence: pg no: 110, L53-L54)
detailed_rules.explanation: For rehabilitation encounters, the condition being rehabilitated should be the first-listed or principal diagnosis when the condition is still present (Evidence: pg no: 110, L53-L54)

detailed_rules.rule_text: If the condition for which the rehabilitation service is being provided is no longer present, report the appropriate aftercare code as the first-listed or principal diagnosis, unless the rehabilitation service is being provided following an injury (Evidence: pg no: 110, L54-L55)
detailed_rules.explanation: When the original condition has resolved but rehabilitation is still needed, use aftercare codes, except for injury-related rehabilitation (Evidence: pg no: 110, L54-L55)

detailed_rules.rule_text: For rehabilitation services following active treatment of an injury, assign the injury code with the appropriate seventh character for subsequent encounter as the first-listed or principal diagnosis (Evidence: pg no: 110, L55-L56)
detailed_rules.explanation: Injury-related rehabilitation uses the injury code with appropriate 7th character rather than aftercare codes (Evidence: pg no: 110, L55-L56)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify that encounter is for rehabilitation
Step 2: Determine if original condition is still present
Step 3: If condition present, code the condition first
Step 4: If condition resolved, determine if injury-related
Step 5: Use aftercare codes for non-injury or injury codes with 7th character for injury
